text:

W&P Design
Anyone who likes to pour themselves a stiff one after work or make decadent drinks for their friends should invest in a fully stocked bar cart.
Even if you're not a cocktail connoisseur, there are some bar tools you should have to make sure your signature martini goes down as smoothly as you intend.
That's where W&P Design comes in. Launched in 2012 by two best friends, Eric Prum and Josh Williams, the brand is dedicated to making durable products that will improve the time spent at your bar cart.
"We’re changing the food and beverage world, one idea at a time," the founders wrote on the website. "Our mission? To bring new (sometimes crazy) products to life that will make your everyday encounters with food and drinks more approachable, more functional and, most importantly, more fun!"
In July 2012, the duo launched a Kickstarter campaign for its four-piece mason jar shaker, which made over $74,000, and have gone on to create over 200 tools that simplify your dining, drinking, and entertaining experience. Products range from a classic cocktail muddler to a special ice tray that makes crushed ice for you, so it's a great place to buy the basics to bring your bartending skills to the next level.
While there are many companies that make barware tools, W&P's products are hard to beat. The company oversees every step of its process from design to delivery to ensure you're getting the best quality for a reasonable price.
Below, 10 bar tools from W&P Design worth drinking to.
View As: One Page Slides Moscow mule carry on kit W&P Design You can now enjoy a Moscow mule on the go.
The Moscow Mule Carry On Kit, from $24
Crushed ice tray W&P Design Making crushed ice has never been easier. Simply pour water into this tray's thin slots, and the specially designed lid will take care of the rest.
W&P Design Crushed Ice Tray, $12
The bartender's knife W&P Design This handsome knife is great for slicing and peeling, plus you can use the pointed tip to fish out olives for your martini.
W&P Design The Bartender's Knife, $40
Mason stones W&P Design These soapstone cubes will keep a glass of whiskey cold without watering down your pour.
W&P Design Mason Stones, $17
Salt rimmer W&P Design A salted glass rim is the perfect finishing touch on any margarita.
W&P Salt Rimmer, $20
Mason shaker W&P Design Here's a cocktail shaker you'll actually want to show off on your bar cart.
W&P The Mason Shaker, $29
Jigger W&P Design Haven't we all had a gin and tonic that's a little too heavy on the gin? This jigger is designed to measure out a half shot and full shot so you'll never sip on a disproportionate drink again.
W&P Design Jigger, $12
Mason jar tap W&P Design W&P Design's clever pour spout makes it easy for aspiring bartenders to infuse and distribute their drinks.
W&P Design The Mason Tap, $20
Muddler W&P Design A smart buy for anyone who likes mojitos.
W&P Design Muddler, $12
Stirred cocktail set W&P Design Like your drinks stirred, not shaken? This set features everything you need to make a neat cocktail, including a strainer, bar spoon, mixing glass, and large ice cube tray.
W&P The Stirred Cocktail Set, $70
